basics.name: Dr. Atrash Mohsin
basics.label: Multilingual R&D Engineer
basics.summary: Multilingual, interdisciplinary engineer with over 10 years of experience in R&D, specialising in innovative problem-solving, project management, and quality assurance across industries such as motorsport (F1), automotive, aerospace, and energy. Proven ability to manage complex technical projects, drive process optimisation, and ensure regulatory compliance.

work.name: Sauber Motorsport AG
work.summary: Leading design, analysis, and optimisation of F1 car components, ensuring structural integrity and performance compliance while managing cross-functional R&D projects.
highlights: Led the design and optimisation of F1 car components, focusing on structural integrity, weight, and performance compliance.
Managed cross-functional projects, overseeing timelines, budgets, and team resources.
Integrated structural components with aerodynamic elements, ensuring compliance with industry regulations.

work.name: Empa (with Carbo-Link AG)
work.summary: Led the development of advanced composite materials for civil structures, focusing on energy efficiency and safety regulations.
highlights: Spearheaded development of thermoplastics and composite anchorage systems.
Led R&D teams in designing and testing novel composite materials.
Collaborated with interdisciplinary teams to innovate energy-efficient applications in composite engineering.

work.name: Schlumberger
work.summary: Developed dynamic FEA models and contributed to intellectual property by filing patents, enhancing energy-efficient processes for drilling applications.
highlights: Developed dynamic FEA models for drilling applications.
Filed patents on novel engineering solutions, particularly in material applications.
Prepared technical documentation to support global product deployment, ensuring compliance with international standards.

work.name: TechnipFMC / University of Aberdeen
work.summary: Designed and tested subsea load-bearing connectors, ensuring compliance with deep-sea industry regulations.
highlights: Designed subsea load-bearing connectors for deep-sea industry.
Managed testing protocols including thermal and cyclic testing.

work.name: Imperial College London
work.summary: Developed innovative experimental and numerical models for composite materials, contributing to automotive and aerospace sectors.
highlights: Developed models for composite materials used in automotive and aerospace industries.
Conducted technical presentations and prepared documentation in line with regulatory requirements.

work.name: Purdue University
work.summary: Designed high-velocity impact tests for thermoplastic composites in aerospace and defence.

work.name: KAIST
work.summary: Characterised mechanical behaviour of polymer nanocomposites for automotive applications.

courses: Manufacturing, testing, modelling, and failure analysis of composites for automotive and aerospace applications
Computational fluid dynamics of F1 cars—a study of the evolution of drag and downforce in F1 since the 1950’s
Mathematical modelling of bridge dynamics—a study of nonlinear response of pedestrian-induced lateral vibrations of the Millenium bridge, London

awards.title: Performed by SLB Bronze Award
awards.summary: Awarded for innovative work on a novel predictive tool for drillbit performance.

publications.name: Nine (9) scientific publications in world-leading journals
publications.summary: List of publications is available upon request.
